alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 10:53PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Union and eastern York Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1051 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary with strong winds along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Monroe to near Indian Land to 9 miles north of Rock Hill. Movement was south at 20 mph. Strong thunderstorms behind the outflow boundary will push into Eastern York and Western Union Counties and will bring heavy rain, lightning, and gusty winds as well. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rock Hill, Monroe, Indian Trail, Weddington, Fort Mill, Stallings, Tega Cay, Wesley Chapel, Waxhaw and Lake Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
